result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachery R Bowen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will complete an AODA assessment and complete any follow up recommended.

DE will maintain absolute sobriety.

DE will apply to Rusk County Drug/Alcohol Court, if accepted will successfully complete.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.

No days credit on this case if revoked.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachery R Bowen

records.addlTxt:
01:23 PM Defendant Zachery R Bowen in court with attorney Andrew T Knaak.  Defendant Zachery R Bowen in custody.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Zachery R Bowen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Heard along with 20CF139, 21CF33, 21CF128, 21CF224, 21CM7, 22CF28.  Court has colloquy with DE on appearance via ZOOM as opposed to personal appearance. 

20CF139- CT'S 1,2   CT'S 3,4,5,will be DRI

21CM7-CT 1

21CF33-CT'S 2,3   CT'S 1,4,5 will be DRI

21CF128-CT 3    CT'S 1,2,4,5,6 will be DRI

21CF224-CT'S 4,6  CT'S 1,2,3,5,7,8 will be DRI

22CF28-CT 1  DE will waive PH.  Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE makes waiver knowingly,freely and voluntarily, court will accept waiver of PH. Will bind over for Trial. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily made, court accepts plea of NC, finds DE guilty.

Sentencing argument entered by parties.  

Sentence will be withheld, 5 years probation. As conditions DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended,  DE will maintain absolute sobriety,  DE will apply for Rusk County Drug/Alcohol Court and if accepted successfully complete the program, pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge, pay DOM assessment.  21CF128-Ct 3 DE will complete 100 hours of community service as required under WI Stats. 961.49 and pay restitution of $354.48
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
NOH FOR 3/08/22  NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED, UNABLE TO FORWARD
